title: Alexandra Palace Walk Route

images.title: E Gammie / Alexandra Palace, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Alexandra Palace. The first Alexandra Palace was opened in 1873 as a 'peoples palace' but was destroyed by fire soon afterwards. The second palace opened in 1875 and in 1980 this, too, was largely destroyed by fire. I believe there was some discussion as to whether to demolish it completely but it was rebuilt and reopened in 1988. This shows it in 1982 with scaffolding supporting the walls.

images.title: Oxyman / Phoenix Bar, Alexandra Palace, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Phoenix Bar in the park. Located on the southern corner of Alexandra Palace

images.title: Chris Downer / Alexandra Palace: mast, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Alexandra Palace: mast Looking across the golf course in Alexandra Palace Park, towards the mast on the eastern corner of the Palace, from which the BBC started transmitting television pictures on 2 November 1935.

images.title: Julian Osley / Woodland walk in Alexandra Palace, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Woodland walk in the park

images.caption: South West End of Alexandra Palace

images.title: Oxyman / Alexandra Palace Park, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footpath in the park

images.title: Chris Downer / Alexandra Palace Park: the lake, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lake view. A swan and goose parade alongside this boating lake within the park grounds.

images.title: Julian Osley / "Leo the Lion" statue, Alexandra Park, North London, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Leo the Lion statue

description: Enjoy a walk or cycle through this popular park in North London. The park covers nearly 200 acres and surrounds the historic entertainment venue of Alexandra Palace. It includes a pretty boating lake where you can enjoy a boat ride or a lakeside snack at the cafe. There is a also a large garden centre with a Victorian style greenhouse, a deer enclosure with a small herd of fallow deer and a 10 hole pitch and putt golf course. You can also climb the park's tree-lined sloping hill where you can enjoy super views over London. Alexandra Park is located between Wood Green and Muswell Hill. Alexandra Palace railway station (Muswell Hill branch) is located right next to the eastern end of the park. The Parkland Walk starts in Alexandra Park, so you could pick up this lovely trail to extend your walk. It runs for about 4 miles along the course of an old railway line to Finsbury Park, via Highgate Wood and Crouch End. The long distance Capital Ring also passes just to the south of the park. This will take you on a tour of some of London's best parks and gardens.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a few good option within in the park for refreshments. The Phoenix Bar & Kitchen has outdoor seating overlooking the capital or inside there's the beautiful Palm Court. There's also a lakeside cafe which is a great place to relax on warmer days. The cafe has a good menu and also displays paintings by local artists.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park's woodland and open grassland are ideal for a dog walk and you will probably see plenty of other owners on your outing.

display_address: Lower Road, Haringey Heartlands, Hornsey, London Borough of Haringey, London, Greater London, England, N22 7AX, United Kingdom
